application.name: raw2isis
application.brief: Import raw cube into Isis format
application.description: This program will import a raw image into an Isis cube. Bytes will be swapped if necessary and there is an option to create special pixels.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the raw filename. If multi-band, it is assumed to be in band sequential order.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the output filename

parameter.name: SAMPLES
parameter.brief: Number of samples in raw image
parameter.description: This defines the number of samples in the raw image.

parameter.name: LINES
parameter.brief: Number of lines in raw image
parameter.description: This defines the number of lines in the raw image.

parameter.name: BANDS
parameter.brief: Number of bands in raw image
parameter.description: This defines the number of bands in the raw image. If greater than 1, the image is assumed to be in band sequential order.

parameter.name: SKIP
parameter.brief: Number of bytes to skip before reading data
parameter.description: This defines the number of bytes to skip before the actual image data is read. This would be for raw images with header data.

parameter.name: BITTYPE
parameter.description: Bit type of data: 8 bit, 16 bit signed, or 32 bit

option.description: Pixels are in 8-bit data range (0 to 255).
Pixels are in 16 bit unsigned data range (0 to 65535)
Pixels are in 16 bit signed data range (-32767 to 32767)
Pixels are in the 32 bit floating point data range

parameter.name: BYTEORDER
parameter.description: Indicates the byte order of the data. Options are LSB (Least Significant Byte firs) or MSB (Most Significant Byte first).

option.description: Least Significant Byte first. Possible architectures include: Intel and Amd.
Most Significant Byte first. Possible architectures include: Sun and Mac.

parameter.name: SETNULLRANGE
parameter.description: If this option is used input raw pixels below minimum and above maximum will be converted to LRS and HRS respectively. Otherwise pixels in the input raw file will be left unchanged in most cases. For example, importing a raw 8-bit file and outputing to a 16-bit or 32-bit real will cause 0 and 255 to be actual values. If left as 8-bit then 0 will be NULL and 255 will be HRS.

parameter.name: NULLMIN
parameter.description: Minimum valid value. Anything below this value will be set to LRS.

parameter.name: NULLMAX
parameter.description: Maximum valid value. Anything above this value will be set to HRS.
